    Author:
    Alex Koppon

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkAddingStock()
      Ensure that stock can be added to the truck after creation
      void checkCapacity()
      Check that the truck returns the correct remaining capacity after being loaded with stock
      void checkCapacity2()
      Check that the truck returns the correct remaining capacity after having stock added to it twice
      void checkCost()
      Check that the truck returns the correct cost using the given stock with a temperature requirement -10
      void checkCost2()
      Check that the truck returns the correct cost for the given stock with a temperature requirement of -20
      void checkCreation()
      Ensure that creating a truck object does not throw any errors
      void checkCreationwithStock()
      Ensure that a Truck object can also be created with a Stock Object
      void checkManifest()
      Check that the truck produces the appropriate string in the format used by Manifest.
      void checkStock()
      Check that the stock contained in the truck is the same as the stock added to the truck
      void tooMuchStock()
      Ensure that a Truck object does not add a Stock object with more quantity than the truck's capacity.

      • tooMuchStock

        public void tooMuchStock()
                  throws DeliveryException
        Ensure that a Truck object does not add a Stock object with more quantity than the truck's capacity. To ensure this, the Truck object should throw an exception to pass the test.
        Throws:
        DeliveryException

      • checkManifest

        public void checkManifest()
                   throws DeliveryException,
                          StockException
        Check that the truck produces the appropriate string in the format used by Manifest. For one item the format will be: ">Refrigerated\nitem,quantity\n"
        Throws:
        DeliveryException
        StockException
